intro: Ornithogalum graecum subsp. ciliolatum, commonly known as the Greek star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial bulbous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers in spring. The plant is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade conditions. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its bulbs are toxic and should be handled with care.
